{{knowledge objective |Identifiant=OIC-260-04-B |Item_parent=Hematuria |Item_parent_short=Hematuria |Rank=B |Title=Knowing the localising value of macroscopic haematuria |Description=None |Rubric=Positive diagnosis |Contributors=Charles Dariane, Bruno Moulin |Order=4}}
Macroscopic haematuria of urological origin may be isolated or accompanied by pain, clots or burning. *Macroscopic haematuria, the chronology of the haematuria during micturition has a localising value: **'''Initial haematuria''': urethro-prostatic or bladder neck origin. **Terminal haematuria'' : bladder origin. **Total haematuria'' (the entire duration of micturition): may be of renal origin (urological or nephrological) but has less localising value, especially in the case of abundant haematuria. Macroscopic haematuria of nephrological origin is complete, without clots, pain or urinary burning. The nephrological origin is often confirmed by the presence of associated proteinuria.

question.title: What is the localising value of macroscopic haematuria during micturition?
question.description: The type of haematuria that has a localising value during micturition

option_a.title: Terminal haematuria
option_a.description: Haematuria that occurs at the end of micturition

option_b.title: Initial haematuria
option_b.description: Haematuria that occurs at the beginning of micturition

properties.option_d: Haematuria that occurs during the entire duration of micturition
